reviews.text: Lovely park. Be sure to visit on a Sunday when there are extra seating areas and food stalls, music and entertainment. It’s a well maintained and beautiful park in front of the old cathedral. Got your Instagram letters to get you photo fix, lots of seating, a flag. It’s worth a wander. Also check out the covered walkway beside the catheter as they often display art to the public in there. The square is missing some nice cafes around the edge, unfortunately the best spots are occupied by a 7eleven, subway and a couple of dodgy diner looking places

Beautiful local square with lots of places to sit back and people watch!!  Make sure to go in the evenings and check out all the activities that happen there on weekends and during certain times of the year where special festivals are held! There are also lots of street vendors selling a variety of different local desserts and cuisine’s. be aware of the high volume of traffic and people waking very quickly. The cathedral is spectacular and you can walk in and respectfully look around.
I was saddened to see the large amounts of garbage in the city although there are cans everywhere the locals don’t seem to care too much about littering!

Great place to relax in the center of town. If you're driving like we did, plenty of places to park really cheap. Near lots of food and shopping, prepare to spend the day and take in the local history.
Loved the horse carriage ride. The church is very old and it shows, but that is part of its charm.
It is a great place to people watch. Plus  just had four pairs of shoes polished for 100.00 pesos great deal.
So I'm not a big fan of modern art, but still this was fun.  Some of the photography exhibits were great.

Beautiful museum! It is free to enter, and it wasn't busy at all. The García Ponce exhibits were really nice, I really enjoy his work. I also loved the variety of pieces from other artists, and especially liked seeing a Diego Rivera painting. This is such a great museum, I will definitely be back!
Fantastic modern art museum in central Merida. Admission is free and be sure to check for hours of operation

I consider one of the best museum of the city. The museum has 4 seasons of temporary exhibitions during the year, so the content usually is quite interesting. Also the permanent rooms shows the work of well known artists from Yucatan. It is located in the heart of the city and free entrance.
Great museum with a variety of exhibitions. Not very big so you can finish it in 1-2 hours. And it is free so worth a visit!
Edificio de la Municipalidad de Heredia.
Muy buen trato
Es muy lindo
Edificio bien conservado
Rapida atencion muy buena

Beautiful museum with lots of Mayan history! We were pleased that nearly all the information signs have an English translation. I think it would be best to go a couple of times and focus on different areas each time. At the beginning we were soaking it all in, but by the last half it felt like information overload... in one ear and out the other.

They had good ideas to build a museum with an interesting structure and interactive, presenting a great civilization;  yet, it was poorly executed.   The outside structure doesn't look anything like a tree that meant to look like.  Inside,  it is not really interactive and flows poorly.  The items displayed,  for most part are not that unique and special. 
This is an honest opinion.

Interesting information on the history of Yucatan. It takes about 2 hours to see most of it. Lots of pictures, sculptures and samples of the Mayan culture. The  Description is in Mayan, Spanish and English language. No guide available, but many friendly employees to show you the way.

Interesting museum with some great pieces and interactive sections. Aside for the video animations and a couple of plaques most of the information in the museum is available in Spanish and English which was awesome. You learn about the formation of the land of the Yucatan - back to the dinosaurs and the meteor - through to the different stages of Mayan civilisation, and from Spanish invasion up to the present day. Not a massive museum but enough information to keep you busy for a few hours. Bring a light jumper, the air con in there is serious.

Mayan cultural museum definitely worth a visit when in Mérida.  It starts with the story of the dinosaur extinction by meteorites and then extends into Mayan civilization.  There are several educational videos that are in Spanish.  However, all the main exhibits do have English captions and descriptions.  We learned a lot about Mayan history, language, beliefs and customs.

Nicely put small museum. Worth a visit if you're in the area. It has some information on main Yucatan singers and listen to their songs.
It is a small town museum with some charm. Don't expect the Louvre.
Neat museum, with great displays and lots of Mexican music antiquities to look at. On the other hand, I wish there was English information to read on the displays.
Attended a special program highlighting Yucatecan culture, music.  Multimedia presentation, live music, food gratis.
It was nice to see actually pieces of our cities history.

Very bohemian love the live music didn't get to see the museum because it was closed there was bohemian music played on this occasion. Me fascino la musica Bohemia Todo muy bonito no logre ver El Museo x q estaba cerrado pero disfrute del festival de la musica Bohemia 👍
A gallery that is definitely worth seeing. Amazing sculptures and paintings.
AMAZING ART WORK; MUST VISIT FOR ART ENTHUSIASTS IN MÉRIDA
Met the daughter and spent time being with the art. Unrushed, lovely setting.

The artist's & owners of Nahualli  (Abel & Melva) are not only extremely talented but also engaged with their community and gracious hosts. No uppity art vibes  at the gallery even though their work is of international fame. BREATH-TAKING ART!

Purchased a 
powerful drawing by Melva, who is as lovely as her art.

Amazing and breath taking, this is just a couple of ways to describe Iglesia El Jesús! I was blown away when I walked into this church, it is so BEAUTIFUL! I couldn't help sitting for a while to take it all in. Don't judge a book by it's cover!
COMO PARTE DE MI TRABAJO TURÍSTICO, LLEVÉ A UN GRUPO TE TURISTAS A MÉRIDA, YUCATÁN Y VERDADERAMENTE ESTÁ MUY BIEN CUIDADA LA CATEDRAL Y OTRAS IGLESIAS DE LA CAPITAL YUCATECA.
La Iglesia es de tamaño mediano y antiguo, aunque su fachada es simple y minimalista es bonita, esta ubicada entre dos pequeñas plazas, todo se encuentra bien cuidado y limpio
Церква гармонійно вписується в оточуючий архітектурний ансамбль. Відкрита лише в певний час, може бути зачинена в обідню пору.
Lugar muy bonito y además hay muchos otros lugares cercanos que puedes visitar caminando.
Beautiful building, great interior. Classic Spanish style. A very respected place for the Virgin Mary of Guadalupe.
cute

Me encantó sus dos torres y el estilo de la misma, templos que datan de muchos años de historia, tiene un retablo muy hermoso, la bóveda es muy alta lo que de un agradable ambiente fresco en su interior. 
Visitarla es conocer más la cuidad, se ubica sobre la calles 50 y 69 de Mérida.

Una de las iglesias más icónicas de la ciudad de Mérida. Muy bonita con la arquitectura de la antigua colonia aunque la ubicación es algo complicada por el tráfico que ya tiene la ciudad. Es el centro de reunión de los guadalupanos en diciembre y en esas épocas es algo complicado pasar por allí. Pero fuera de eso muy bonita

Iglesia de Guadalupe edificio que conserva su fachada colonial todos los días hay misa e igual. Se ofrecen misas para bodas bautizos XV años celebraciones conmemorativas cada 12 de diciembre llegan muchos antorchsitas por su promesas que le hacen a la virgen de Guadalupe en esos días las celebraciones de las misa se realiza en la parte de afuera sobre la calle para poder recibir a más fieles devotos
Hermoso edificio.
Excelente lugar para conocer Mérida y su historia colonial. Ambiente familiar y precios económicos, aparte de que los lugared están céntricos de la ciudad blanca Mérida.
Exelente lugar para venir a pasear y conoser la historia de trenes de la ciudad de merida
Porque el tren es el transporte más útil y en México este transporte no existe para los usuarios, debido a que un ex-presidente decidió privatizarlos, ¡es el colmo!
Cuando funcionaba era lo máximo .ahora es lugar histórico y esta abandonó .da mucha pena .siendo patrimonio de Mérida. Ojo pidan dinero para cuidado.
Excelente lugar para sacar fotos, muy centrico y llegando a la esquina hay una tienda con deliciosa comida
Buen lugar para visitar y pasar el día
Excelente lugar para citar a alguien
Junto al arco se encuentra el sitio de taxis para Maxcanú.
Le falta una buena pintada!
Beautiful
Hermoso arco en la antigua entrada del oriente de la ciudad. Muy bien conservado y que da un aire de Ciudad amurallada. Ideal para visitarlo caminando para disfrutar en todo su esplendor.

Es asombroso como aun se conservan monumentos historicos en la Ciudad de Mérida.
 El arco de dragones, que tambien era considerado como una de las entradas a la Ciudad de Merida.

El arco de “Dragones”, que se le conoce así porque se ubica a un costado del “Cuartel de Dragones”, conserva en lo más alto de su construcción una escultura, dentro de un nicho, que sobrevive a la erosión de los años
Bien cuidado y tal vez de un interés por personas interesadas en arquitectura

This is a beautiful home. Your visit costs 85 pesos and starts with a 10 minute explanation including historical information about the previous owners.  You are then free to explore and read descriptions as you go.
The basement of the house is where the work happened and worth spending some time. There are grounds but nothing left of the gardens. The gift shop is nice but average.

It is a beautiful, grand old house.  It has been kept true to the period it was built.  It is very cozy and the guides are very friendly.  It represents an important period in the history of Merida and Yucatán in general.  They are building a cultural center in the back as well as a gallery. What used to be the garden is rented out for events or small concerts. The infrastructure is quite adequate for them.
Amazing place to visit. Beautiful Spanish colonial mansion.
Very nice home to tour. Guide spoke great English. Reasonable price. Tour lasts 35-40 minutes.
great place to see how the elites lived in pre-revolutionary merida.  very well kept place

This is a small museum of mostly just old trains that you can climb into and peek around. Which is great for kids, and also kind of cool for adults.we also saw a few iguanas climbing around the trains. 

I don’t think I learned anything about trains but it was pretty neat still and I think it was 60 pesos for us as a family of 4. Bathrooms were nice and clean and staff was really pleasant. If you asked them questions I’m sure they’d be really helpful but we were just happy exploring the trains.

This was a good way to spend a day. The entrance is through a guarded gate that seems like it is closed but is not. The guard will point you to the ticket stand /  table and staff. You will need small cash as there may not be a great deal of change with the staff. 

The site can be warm so a water or refreshment is advisable. There was nothing there during our visit. 

We chose to take a taxi to the site and the bus back to Centro at the Mercado in Centro. 
 
I enjoyed walking around and inside many of the train cars that have been collected.  The cars and engines are from Canada, USA and Mexico. Some are in poor shape, others are accessible for viewing. The volunteer staff were helpful and provided a starting point for our self directed tour. 

There are photos in one car and a large model HO train track being built with lots of interesting miniature buildings, lights, people and more.

This is a train buffs delight for sure.

Enjoy.
Needs funding because some great pieces are going to disappear.
Enterance fee 20 peso for adults. Museum needs some basic information about objects in museum. You can get info in spanish from people working here.
Super fun place!  The kids loved it!

Beautiful museum with lots of Mayan history! We were pleased that nearly all the information signs have an English translation. I think it would be best to go a couple of times and focus on different areas each time. At the beginning we were soaking it all in, but by the last half it felt like information overload... in one ear and out the other.

They had good ideas to build a museum with an interesting structure and interactive, presenting a great civilization;  yet, it was poorly executed.   The outside structure doesn't look anything like a tree that meant to look like.  Inside,  it is not really interactive and flows poorly.  The items displayed,  for most part are not that unique and special. 
This is an honest opinion.

Interesting information on the history of Yucatan. It takes about 2 hours to see most of it. Lots of pictures, sculptures and samples of the Mayan culture. The  Description is in Mayan, Spanish and English language. No guide available, but many friendly employees to show you the way.

Interesting museum with some great pieces and interactive sections. Aside for the video animations and a couple of plaques most of the information in the museum is available in Spanish and English which was awesome. You learn about the formation of the land of the Yucatan - back to the dinosaurs and the meteor - through to the different stages of Mayan civilisation, and from Spanish invasion up to the present day. Not a massive museum but enough information to keep you busy for a few hours. Bring a light jumper, the air con in there is serious.

Mayan cultural museum definitely worth a visit when in Mérida.  It starts with the story of the dinosaur extinction by meteorites and then extends into Mayan civilization.  There are several educational videos that are in Spanish.  However, all the main exhibits do have English captions and descriptions.  We learned a lot about Mayan history, language, beliefs and customs.

Really a nice place, they prepare good food in all times of the day, they have a cool presentation and it also understand very good the English so you do not going to get any difficulty to order, to resume, it is great

Excellent service and the best time to visit is breakfast. Their breakfast plates range from light with oatmeal or fruit to heavy with huevos motuleños or chilaquiles. The coffe is good and the orange juice and fruit cup fresh, but their stand out is the nice courtyard they have inside. A pleasant place to have a delicious breakfast and start off the day right.
Food was better than average cafeteria food. The staff was very pleasant. Inexpensive burgers, decent cappuccino.
Best traditional Mexican breakfast. Food was so good with reasonable price and staff are so nice. Cleanliness would be an issue I think that's why I took one star off.
Great cafe, great food

Decent food, great service, server was able to communicate with us in English and or limited Spanish. Great choice of food, especially pizza. Large pizza serves 3-4 people, 2 people are good with a medium. Thin crust, properly cooked. Close to downtown, would go again.

If you are in Merida's downtown you can try this pizzas. These are not the best pizzas but they are very good. I like Hawaiian plus pizza that has jalapeños but also the 4 cheese pizza is delicious, with Philadelphia cheese in all the side of the pizza!

Delicious pizza, thin crust,, we had the large 3 topping veggie with lots of leftovers for 2 ppl.
The stuffed mushroom caps are yummy 😋 
Waiter was great with passable English!
Close to downtown Merida with easy street parking!
This  italian always talk against american . And sometime fight with the client .one time the police had to be there . Food full of salt. Bad treatement of is employes too.
Great pizza.  Casual atmosphere & family friendly.  Prices are reasonable.  Paid parking near by.  No A/C, so it's best to stop by after sundown.

Good selection, calm ambience. Totally chill staff let us stay until closing time and we never felt pushed out. 4 star because I've seen a wider selection elsewhere; Vegas. They tended to have a lot of German beers. There was a sale on specific beers, I would think that would be regular.
Love this place.  Recomend to everyone who loved good food and good beer.  Good services too
Great German beer selection!  Live music after 9:30 pm.
Good to go with friends and order one of everything.
Great German food. Sausages are authentic and delicious.  Great selection of beers. Käsespaetzele are amazing. I would eat them as a meal.

The atmosphere is a little cramped with all patrons sitting in the same room almost back to back. Wait times are around 15-20 minutes when it's busy but there's very little room to wait so most people are outside on the street corner. It's very interesting seeing local women hand making taco tortillas in every corner of the restaurant but it proves they're fresh and waiters immediately bring them to you (so fresh they're too hot to eat!). 

The food is good but not great, but take that with a grain of salt as I only had the turkey tamales and my girlfriend had the tacos, both of which weren't anything to write home about, but multiple other people seemed to enjoy their meals. 

Drinks are very good and reasonably priced but lacking in alcohol content. Waiters are everywhere and will stop to help you with anything if you flag them down, and the wait time for food isn't too bad, especially with the chips and taco tortillas. 

Overall, the experience is between your average Mexican restaurant and a fancy dine in, with La Chaya Maya trying hard to be on the latter side but not quite hitting it. More experience is needed with the food but it isn't quite what I expected after multiple people had hyped it up so much. I most likely will not go back during my stay here, but if you're looking for an average experience you can give it a try. Not bad, not great, just right in the middle.

Great ambiance. Prices are reasonable. Food is well cooked and service is great. Orders came out pretty fast and together. Great for someone who just dropped in and wants to try something native to the region; there's also safer plainer options for the not so adventurous.

The picture isn't great and doesn't do justice. The best food in town so far, strongly recommend it, home made, natural, freshly done, amazing flavours, also good price and quality. Coming back to eat again for sure!

This was one of the most amazing meals I have ever had. I had the chicken in the banana leaves (not sure what it was actually called) and it was by far and large the best chicken i have ever had. So tender and such a huge portion! You will not be disappointed. Service was very friendly and you can feel the love put into everything on the table. I would highly highly recommend.

Excellent service,  the food is really tasty, I love the fact that they have some women making hand made tortillas that is a huge plus for me, I am Mexican for that, having fresh tortillas is a big deal. This restaurant is a MUST if you travel to Merida, totally recommended.

The atmosphere is a little cramped with all patrons sitting in the same room almost back to back. En mi opinión me gusta mas que la competencia directa, tiene mejor sabor, mejores precios y con eso se ha ganado mi preferencia.
Sinceramente mis queridos lectores fui una vez pero todo caro !! Pero lamento informarles que ya cerraron !!
Buen servicio
Muy rico lugar
muy buen servicio
Great food and drinks.  My wife has to eat gluten free and they explained everything that was in her entree. She had no issues and we plan to go back when were in Merida next week.

My wife and I ate there for the last night we were in Merida. I had the Relleno Negro, it was complex in taste, a bit spicy, a real delight. It was Sunday afternoon early dinner, but there was a good crowd. It was highly recommend, and I must say it was some of the best I had the pleasure to try.
Grate place to eat autentic yucatan cuisine grate service
Authentic place to eat local food & sometimes there is live music.

Great service, amazingly tasty Yucantan food & definitely plan to return!!  Gluten free options for this Celtic girl too 💗 
Mucho gracias 😍

Lovely quiet lunch in back patio. We came here based on google reviews on a Sunday afternoon when we arrived in Merida - we got a table in the back, so lovely and quiet -  we were so tired, the service was really nice, drinks were done well as was the food - I ordered the mayan chicken holiday dish and my partner ordered steak, very good quality. Enjoyed our meals and the atmosphere.
The outdoor dining area is a quiet oasis.  Great service, drinks and food.  Best sopa de lima had yet in Merida.  We will be back.

I had the best dinner all week here. The service was great. I ordered a seafood zarzuela that came with rice. It had shrimp, calamari, crab, fish, and other seafood with a very tasty red sauce. That along with 2 cocktails (a margarita x a daquri) and cheesecake with strawberry topping was only $20 USD!! The prices here are amazing and my food was very delicious and tender. I would come here over and over again...great value!

Poorly made food.  Guacamole and salsa tasted strange.  The chips we're very hard and stale.  The mole tasted like straight chili powder and shrimp tasted unwashed and super salty. The smell of the bathrooms filled the dinning area. We did not eat our food.  Paid and left, they didn't even apologize.

We found this restaurant by accident on new years day, it was the nearest definitely open restaurant near to us, what a wonderful surprise, actually the best food we have eaten in our three weeks in this area, and really cheap. Staff were very friendly and service was quick, although we were early. Recommend the sopa da Lima, delicious. Nice ambience.
Great place to eat. Drinks were delicious. Service was great.
Don't think it was their fault, but it was overcrowded and thus, service wasn't great
Excelente ambiente, vinos  y la mejor atención !! Lo recomiendo ampliamente, definitivamente regreso.
Linda decoración aunque los precios se me. Hacen algo elevados
Excelente lugar, muy romántico, ideal para aniversarios o fechas especiales, comida muy rica a buen precio

On a hot day after riding bikes for the Sunday city bike ride, the milkshakes here really hit the spot! The chocolate was a little spicy, like an iced Mexican hot chocolate. The corn was sweet, crunchy, and refreshing. The waiter didn't speak much English and we don't speak much Spanish, but he managed to help us order and get exactly what we wanted. A sweet spot that is perfect for a refreshing treat and great people watching.

Awesome little ice cream and sorbet on the strip of Paseo de Montejo.
Tried their mamey fruit sorbet, almost to rich but had the fruits flavor nailed.
Just have the Coco or the vanilla and cinnamon and you will understand why five stars is low for this place.
Place to go for ice cream and dessert conveniently located at Paseo de Montejo
great people watching and a super yummy selection of sorbets (guava, guanabana, chocolate, melon, corn!)

On a hot day after riding bikes for the Sunday city bike ride, the milkshakes here really hit the spot! The chocolate was a little spicy, like an iced Mexican hot chocolate. The corn was sweet, crunchy, and refreshing. The waiter didn't speak much English and we don't speak much Spanish, but he managed to help us order and get exactly what we wanted. A sweet spot that is perfect for a refreshing treat and great people watching.

Awesome little ice cream and sorbet on the strip of Paseo de Montejo.
Tried their mamey fruit sorbet, almost to rich but had the fruits flavor nailed.
Just have the Coco or the vanilla and cinnamon and you will understand why five stars is low for this place.
Place to go for ice cream and dessert conveniently located at Paseo de Montejo
great people watching and a super yummy selection of sorbets (guava, guanabana, chocolate, melon, corn!)
Best bakery on town... Traditionally made bread at affordable prices

Excellent for pastries and desserts.  Did not have bread on our visits.
Go early to avoid disappointment.
What a unique and fabulous experience. The baked goods are fresh and melt in your mouth delicious.

Awesome place to visit. The wonderfully sweet smell of baked goods that fill the air as you walk in will overload your senses. The baked goods are like no other, if this place was in my home town I would be in trouble.
Delicious food. Make sure you bring cash because they don't take credit/debit.

The entrance fee is 100 mxn, but it is totally worth it. Then they offer you a guide for not an specifically cost (just the tip that you want to give them). I'm not sure if there are explanations in English, but you can call and ask for it.  Really nice place.
Interesting Hacienda, turned into a museum. One can see some original styled rooms and the old machinery. Entry 100 Pesos is a bit steep though. Good stop on the way to Puuc.
It's a nice colonial hacienda, although I would have expected a bit more history to be provided by signs or any other forms, as well as the size of the hacienda itself..

Worth a stop if you are passing through, perhaps not for a special visit. The place was somewhat deserted so hard to understand the history of the place. The main house is well preserved. We walked the grounds for 30mins and left.
So beautiful and surreal. Very interesting history. Great old machines, gardens.
